item.title: Expressing support for the designation of September 2017 as "Campus Fire Safety Month".

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6398; text: CR S6390)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6398; text: CR S6390)

summary.text:
Designates September 2018 as Campus Fire Safety Month.

Encourages administrators of institutions of higher education and municipalities across the United States to: (1) provide educational programs about fire safety to all college students in September and throughout the school year, (2) evaluate the level of fire safety being provided in both on- and off-campus student housing, and (3) ensure fire-safe living environments.

Designates September 2018 as Campus Fire Safety Month.

Encourages administrators of institutions of higher education and municipalities across the United States to: (1) provide educational programs about fire safety to all college students in September and throughout the school year, (2) evaluate the level of fire safety being provided in both on- and off-campus student housing, and (3) ensure fire-safe living environments.

bill.title: A resolution designating September 2018 as "Campus Fire Safety Month".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
